comment: The course was decent, but some concepts were harder to grasp. The class also has homework and a quiz almost every week. However, I will say that this course wasn't hard for me. If you do your work for the first month, then the rest of the course will fall into place.

Her class was the most stressful of my course load. I tried emailing her a few times, and only got a response a week before the end of semester. She expects your face and hands to show during a test, which is near impossible with a laptop. The lecture tries to cover too many topics at once, making it overwhelming and hard to follow.

requires a web cam. For the record, I have always been an online student, and none of my professors have ever required something so silly. I do not live close enough to library to check out a web cam, nor do I have time to go after my fulltime job. I also don't have the money to spend on a webcam. Not an institutional policy, incredibly annoying

Unreasonable demands for online tests, etc. Seating chart used to make sure everyone in the class is answering questions and contributing. Overall boring/easy class made harder than it has to be by professor requirements. 2 free absences then you start losing points

She is a good professor and makes the class easy. Even though the content isn't super difficult to begin with. The only thing is for exams, lockdown browser is required and you must show your hands at all times and show your complete environment with "no extra monitors." There is a grade for attendance and there's weekly HW and Quizzes (Not hard).

Professor McCarthy was not a horrible professor, I would just say if you had another choice than her I would choose it. She made this semester way more extra than it had to be all because she doesn't want people to cheat like she held our grades because our lockdown browser environments wasn't what she wanted. Like??? Other assignments are easy.
